column1: #text=Well I have a perfect solution for you , and it 's right under your nose .
#text=Head to your local corner bus stop and travel on another form of transportation !
#text=It 's very simple if you live in an Urban setting , and still pretty simple in the suburbs .
#text=A good resource first is to look up a bus schedule on the internet .
#text=Additionally , you could search the sidewalks for prominent signage that indicates a bus will stop in your area .
#text=Once you decide on where you want to go , and the time at which the bus comes , just head out to this stop and simply wait .
#text=A bus will eventually show up where you can board and pay directly to the bus driver .
#text=Once paid , simply find an open seat and gaze out the window at the bustling of life that you are passing by .
#text=Eventually you will arrive at your destination and can exit the bus .
#text=Once you finish running your errands simply return to another bus spot and find a ride home .
